properties.name: April 16: Gang member gunned down
properties.description: Posted by Calgaryherald72 Saddlecrest. Blvd. N.E. CalgarySon Thahn Nguyen, 26, shot as he was parking in his Saddlecrest Blvd. garage. Nguyen was a high-ranking gang member. Suspects sped off in a car. The day prior, one of Nguyen’s associates was shot in the hand outside Plush nightclub. Unsolved.

properties.name: April 16: Gang member killed
properties.description: Posted by CalgaryheraldSon Thahn Nguyen, 26, shot as he was parking in his Saddlecrest Blvd. garage. Nguyen, a high-ranking FOB gang member. Suspects sped off in a car. The day prior, one of Nguyen’s associates was shot in the hand outside Plush nightclub. Unsolved.

properties.name: Feb. 25: Senior dead, now considered homicide
properties.description: Posted by CalgaryheraldMike MacGregor\'s death, from unreleased causes, is now considered a homicide by police. The senior was found dead after his son phoned 911 and said he\'d found his dad injured in his home.

properties.name: Feb. 26: Mom charged with daughter's murder
properties.description: Posted by Calgaryherald100 fay road, se, calgaryAset Magomadova charged with second-degree murder in the strangulation death of her 14-year-old daughter Aminat in their Fairview home. She is currently free on bail.

properties.name: Jan. 24: Murder, delayed suicide
properties.description: Posted by Calgaryherald120 Sierra Morena Landing S.W. Calgary, AlbertaJan. 24: Police responding to a 911 domestic call find Gizelle McMullen, 48, dead inside her home at 120 Sierra Morena Landing S.W. Her husband Robert Charles McMullen, 52, is taken to hospital with “injuries.” He leaves the hospital without being discharged and two days later is found dead by a friend inside a northeast automotive garage.

properties.name: Jan. 4: Body found in burning dumpster.
properties.description: Posted by Calgaryherald2400 7 Street N.E. CalgaryBurning Dumpster On Jan. 4, the body of Yonas Amahazion, 19, was found burning in a dumpster. He was identified through dental records. The case is unsolved.

properties.name: Mar. 3: Elderly mom murdered, adult son charged
properties.description: Posted by CalgaryheraldMargaret Hetrick found dead inside her home at Hawkdale Gate NW. Son Gregory John Hetrick, 51, charged with second degree murder.

properties.name: Mar. 9: Drug deal gone wrong leaves two dead downtown
properties.description: Posted by CalgaryheraldChristian Blake Blondeau, 35, died of a single stab wound after an attack under the Langevin Bridge. Also dead is Alfons Daniel Kunz, 57, who was stabbed several times. Both are known drug dealers around the Drop-In Centre. Unsolved.

properties.name: Ontario Court of Justice
properties.description: Posted by Calgaryherald361 University Ave, Toronto, Ontario, CanadaSite of John Felderhof’s trial. The Ontario Securities Commission says he sold 4 million in Bre-X stock in 1996 while he allegedly knew of information not disclosed to investors about the state of Bre-X’s gold desposit in Indonesia.

properties.name: Samarinda, Indonesia
properties.description: Posted by CalgaryheraldA dusty, and polluted city of 700,000, Bre-X had an office and warehouse here. Investigators later surmised this is where the salting occurred.

properties.name: The Metro Toronto Convention Centre
properties.description: Posted by Calgaryherald255 Front Street W Toronto, Ontario, CanadaThe cavernous site of the annual Prospectors and Developers Association of Canada annual convention. Bre-X senior vice president John Felderhof was awarded “Prospector of the Year” for his work at Busang in March 1997, only days before the company’s fortunes began to unravel.

properties.name: Villa Catalina, Philippines
properties.description: Posted by CalgaryheraldA community two hours south of Manila, this is where Cesar Puspos, fingered as one of the men who orchestrated the Bre-X mining deception, grew up. His mother and sister still live here. “It has been 10 years, haven’t we suffered enough?” says his sister Olive.

properties.name: Walsh Home, Bahamas
properties.description: Posted by CalgaryheraldDavid Walsh owned a five-bedroom, two-storey colonial-style home on the island of Nassau. He died of a brain aneurysm here in 1998. A report last year said wife Jeannette had sold the family’s mansion in Nassau and is now living in an apartment on Paradise Island.
